## Logistical Regression Weekend Hwk
```{r}
#libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(GGally)
library(janitor)
library(modelr)
library(pROC)
library(caret)
```


```{r}
#data
oj <- read_csv("data/orange_juice.csv") %>% 
  clean_names()
```

```{r}
#exploration
glimpse(oj)
```
From the data and the question I have decided that "purchase" 
is the output variable referring to which juice they have purchased 


```{r}
#converted specials to logical and made purchase_mm variable.
oj <- oj %>% 
  mutate(purchase_mm = ifelse(purchase == "MM", TRUE, FALSE), 
                              .after = purchase,
         special_ch = as.logical(special_ch),
         special_mm = as.logical(special_mm)) 

```

```{r}
oj %>% 
  filter(store7 == "Yes") %>% 
  count(store_id)
```
 
```{r}
alias(purchase_mm ~., data = oj) 
```
 
 From  the alias, I kept: sale_price_mm, sale_price_ch, 
 price_diff, list_price_dif, store_id, purchaseMM, weekof_purchase, special_ch
 special_mm, loyal_ch, pct_disc_mm, pct_disc_ch
 
```{r}
oj_trim <- oj %>% 
  select(sale_price_mm, sale_price_ch, 
 price_diff, list_price_diff, store_id, purchase_mm, weekof_purchase, special_ch,
 special_mm, loyal_ch, pct_disc_mm, pct_disc_ch, store7) %>% 
  mutate(store_id = as.factor(store_id),
         store7 = as.factor(store7),
         purchase_mm = as.factor(purchase_mm))
```
 

```{r}
##ggpairs for first variables
oj_trim %>% 
  select(sale_price_mm, sale_price_ch, 
 price_diff, list_price_diff, store_id, purchase_mm, weekof_purchase, loyal_ch, pct_disc_mm, pct_disc_ch) %>% 
  ggpairs(progress = FALSE)
```
 loyal_ch, pct_discmm, pct_discch & store_id seem to be the most promising for our model
 
```{r}
#ggpairs for second variables
oj_trim %>%  
select(special_ch,
 special_mm, purchase_mm) %>%
  ggpairs(progress = F)
```
Decided to keep both special_ch & special_mm
 
```{r}
oj_model_1 <- glm(
  purchase_mm ~ special_ch + special_mm + loyal_ch + store_id + pct_disc_mm + pct_disc_ch,
  data = oj_trim,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)
```
 
```{r}
summary(oj_model_1)
```
 
```{r}
oj_model_2 <- glm(
  purchase_mm ~ loyal_ch + store_id + pct_disc_mm + pct_disc_ch,
  data = oj_trim,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

summary(oj_model_2)
```

There was a correlation specifically between store 7 and 
purchaseMM 
 
```{r}
oj_model_3 <- glm(
  purchase_mm ~ loyal_ch + store7 + pct_disc_mm + pct_disc_ch,
  data = oj_trim,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

summary(oj_model_3)
```
 
```{r}
oj_model_4 <- glm(
  purchase_mm ~ store7 + pct_disc_mm + pct_disc_ch,
  data = oj_trim,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

oj_model_5 <- glm(
  purchase_mm ~ loyal_ch + pct_disc_mm + pct_disc_ch,
  data = oj_trim,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

oj_model_6 <- glm(
  purchase_mm ~ loyal_ch + store7 + pct_disc_ch,
  data = oj_trim,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

oj_model_7 <- glm(
  purchase_mm ~ loyal_ch + store7 + pct_disc_mm,
  data = oj_trim,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

summary(oj_model_4)
summary(oj_model_5)
summary(oj_model_6)
summary(oj_model_7)

```
model_3 has the lowest AIC and the best fit for making
our predictions. 

```{r}
oj_model3_pred <- oj_trim %>% 
  add_predictions(oj_model_3, type = "response")
```

```{r}
threshold <- 0.6

oj_model3_pred <- oj_model3_pred %>% 
  mutate(pred_threshold_0.6 = pred >= threshold)

conf_matrix <- oj_model3_pred %>% 
  tabyl(purchase_mm)

roc_obj_oj <- oj_model3_pred %>% 
  roc(response = purchase_mm,
      predictor = pred)

roc_curve <- ggroc(
  data = roc_obj_oj,
  legacy.axes = TRUE
) +
  coord_fixed()

roc_curve
```
 
```{r}
auc(roc_obj_oj)
```

# checking with cross validation
```{r}
train_control <- trainControl(method = "repeatedcv",
                              number = 5, 
                              repeats = 100,
                              savePredictions = TRUE,
                              classProbs = TRUE,
                              summaryFunction = twoClassSummary)
```
 
```{r}
#converted logical variable to factor
oj_trim_valid <- oj_trim %>% 
  mutate(purchase_mm = as_factor(purchase_mm),
         purchase_mm = ifelse(purchase_mm == TRUE, "t", "f")) %>% 
  select(purchase_mm, store7, pct_disc_mm, pct_disc_ch, loyal_ch) 
```


 
```{r}
cv_model <- train(purchase_mm ~ loyal_ch + store7 + pct_disc_mm + pct_disc_ch,
               data = oj_trim_valid,
               trControl = train_control,
               method = "glm",
               family = binomial(link = "logit"))
```

```{r}
summary(cv_model)

cv_model$results
```
